column5: Those are amazing!  I know just where to use them.  Late April to early May in the St. Mary's rapids, drifted along bottom and BOOM!
Those are simply fantastic   Never seen artificials tied that look so real----you have a real talent for the smallest detail in your work/craft
You know of course that the more you guys compliment him the more I'll be paying for my dahlbergs. Have a heart will ya?
That's freakin awesome.

Thanks guys and Joey.  I'd like to tell you it's a labour of love but I'd be lying, it's just labour.  I'll respond to a few of the comments in order to keep it somewhat brief.... For those that I didn't quote your comments are truly appreciated, thanks again.   Good job your head wasn't in the way.    Patience and boredom which is compounded by spending the time tying them.    Got a spare bedroom?    When I'm done with him I hope to do a few for myself.    Simple Minds.    SHUTUP!  Bigger ones coming.    Yep, bout an hour each Aaron.    What lake is that?    I can do that!    I told you Roy, to late!!!!!!!!!!!

Okay I was gonna hold off on posting anymore but I just finished these two and had to share.  I think they may be the most realistic flies I've tied to date. Made some changes from the last Brown Stonefly and added in the antennae, a bead head and some brown peacock herl in the thorax to simulate the gills.  I'm thinking the trout, any trout would love 'em.    For size reference the bodies are about 7/8ths of an inch long.
DANG... Leah just smacked my screen with the fly swatter !!
Sweet. No idea how you make them so lifelike..
WOW!!!   Very nice!!!
That's killer!  Very realistic
wow, those are awesome Chris, great work.  Joey
they are awesome you have way more patience then i do.  and they have a real stinger sitting out the back of them  PS: they are NOT legal for you to use at any of the OFC G2G's--lol
Beautiful work by a skilled Craftsman! Very nice!
what could i barter for a few spiel tied flies?
Incredible detail Chris !!
Soon enough the real ones will look fake next to yours Nice craftsmanship bud!
Well done Chris
Very impressive Chris.  Great job!!
Amazing Chris, simply amazing! Well done........
Those are really cool Chris
Amazing as usual. Rick mentioned the other day that they were for him (lucky sod  ).
Mint!  (don't you.....forget about me)
You got mad skills Chris     Incredible I love it    Congrats Keep up the excellent work! Jacques

All that work and I can just imagine the first rainbow or brookie on it...under a nice log jamb and then all of the sudden.... ping! oh crap just broke off in the tangled brush pile!  No different than the undr water camera I recently bought... first time down a hole and what do I see??? A big ol muskie eyeing it up for food! It would have been worth loosing the camera to see it happen!  PS: I think you out did yourself on those 2 Chris.... now back to those 3 inchers I was talking about....
Awesome work Chris! Taking orders soon?
Awesome work.  Keep posting your creations!

Awesome stones Spiel!  Reminds me of my earlier stones I tied.. it took me an hour to tie each one as I copied the real nymph.. don't have that kind of time anymore!  Those are going to kill steelhead, wicked stuff man.  Aaron
Wow comes to mind!  Those are beauties...I'd love to see what the specs on my opener lake would do to those! Cheers,
soooo can you tie me a mosquito? I need it to lure the real ones away from my ass while I am up North this summer.    art
thats some nice work..I commend you
